name: International Sustainability Canada-Mexico
description: This seven day practical field course will provide an opportunity for 4th year undergraduate geography/environment students to gain valuable international experience in environmental sustainability; economics and human health issues. Mexico faces considerable challenges with respect to water resources and environmental sustainability, and environmental expertise in Latin America is in high demand. In addition to tuition fees, there is a travel cost associated with this course which students will be responsible to pay.
prerequisites: 14.5 credits; enrolled in any of the ENV Programs, or affiliated programs such as GGR, ECO, BIO, CHEM), with preference given to program specialists and majors; Application and interview required. Speaking Spanish would be an asset.
